Topic.Title: XC - Seriously Enlighten Me On AMD's Profit From PS4 Console Deal

Message.Msg: XC, The purpose of stock message boards is to try seek out the truth. From way back if I am correct you are a AMD shareholder and should know the information requested. Nvidia has stated that the opportunity costs on the console deals was not attractive to them vs. expected ROI on other businesses in the works. I share your statement that they could not have made an X86 CPU to go with their GPU but perhaps they referring to some other combination...ViA...IBM etc. But put that aside for one moment.AMD has these consoles deals and the volume could be large. AMD's CEO stated that by the 4Q of 2013 "more than 20% of AMD's revenue would be from semi-custom chips. Current analyst revenue projects are for total AMD revenue of slightly over $4B per year. So say 20% is $200M/quarter. Getanid pointed out a few days ago that AMD's semi-custom and embedded annual revenue in 2012 was $271M so using $200M a quarter as the revenue basis for these console deals seems like a fair approximation....i.e. "more than 20%." So now all we need to know is: 1) Is this a deal in which AMD manufactures the chips through their fab foundry partners or 2) Is this a license deal like Nvidia's PS3 deal was? Note: Qty of expected sales for the consoles can be obtained from the tech press I guess. If someone as knowledgeable as you obviously are would post that information then one can determine if Nvidia was correct in passing up the deal. I eagerly look forward to your response to the question on hand. Others please chime in if they have any knowledge on this matter. Thanks....seriously!

Topic.Title: CEO Financial Presentation March 19th 11:30 PT

Message.Msg: Jen's will say: we are taking steps to control the huge Tegra loses. We have started transferring head count from Tegra to GPU. As such, this Q, Tegra loses will be under $100M this Q. By Q2, after all the people have been transferred, we'll take Tegra loses to under $50. Just so people won't thing we are losing 'focus' - those transferred will still be working on Tegras, just the TEgra GPU side and under GPU books. For doing such a great job of controlling Tegras loses, the board has given myself and top management another $10M shares stock grants. This concludes our financial presentation and I am sure you are as pleased about the financial progress of Tegras and I am. Guys, after 5 years of 'technolody', predictions, promises, and huge loses. The only thing left that's real is money.

Message.Title: Finally - Some Cost Data On Cloud Gaming - Nvidia Grid
Message.Msg: "Relan believes that we have arrived at the "inflection point" for cloud gaming. The next two years will herald the emergence of a similar platform to the compute cloud, but based on high-performance GPUs. And, as is often the case with impassioned executives, he has a dog in the fight: Agawi True Cloud, which will offer content creators a choice of server architectures built on Nvidia's Kepler GPUs. With a minimum performance target of 720p resolution at 30 fps with less than 100 milliseconds latency, Agawi True Cloud will cost 39 cents per user hour, per stream. With the release of Nvidia's Maxwell processors in 2014, the price should drop below 20 cents. " Source: gamesindustryDOTbiz/articles/2013-03-12-not-a-cloud-in-sight ______________________________________________________________________ Good article, fairly long article worth reading

Topic.Title: Finally - Some Cost Data On Cloud Gaming - Nvidia Grid

Message.Msg: 40 cents an hour for only 720p, that $70 a game is looking better and better.

Topic.Title: Finally - Some Cost Data On Cloud Gaming - Nvidia Grid

Xbox, and PS4 user.....some will upgrade I would think....especially heavy users, but some might just click on their TV and pay for gaming as they go. Parents of kids might just add the Gaming Channel on their Cable service. Certainly tiered pricing will be available. X Number of hrs for $X dollars with minimum initial outlay or free.

Message.Title: A conversation with OUYA ceo J. Uhrman at EXPAND (March 16-17)
Message.Msg: Uhrmann touched upon a number of key points re. OUYA's business model, some new and others known. --Totally surprised by the success of Kickstarters program (early backers program) saw by OUYA --OUYA game controller intended as an unique product creating its own niche, not competing with Ninendo, Sony or MSFT. Low price point + high performance perceived as key to success. $99. --Business model conceived as Uhrman witnessed change in gaming industry --OUYA currently collaborating with big as well as small publishers. Will get the next version of "Mindcraft" (exclusive?) --7000 developers registered, many first-time devs --Will adopt Mobile Update Model, hardware refreshed annually, as contrast to traditional consoles which gets refreshed once 6-10 years. Future models will be backward compatible. --OUYA device will be all digital, current focus on TV, no wireless version being planned for now --Brushed aluminum chassis designed by famed industrial designer Yves Behar, beta version will be shipped in March to Kickstarters early backers. final version to retailers in June --Will have subscription-based games Note: EXPAND is a new annual event sponsored by Engadget. The inaugural meeting was held in San Francisco March 16-17, 2013. OUYA ceo was one of the featured speakers.

Topic.Title: Before you get Cloud gaming, you need to be able to talk uninterrupted on

Message.Msg: I am not sure you know what cloud gaming is. You seem to be specifically focusing on a branch of cloud gaming pertaining to mobile. Cloud gaming is gaming through network connection, not necessarily mobile network. What do you mean by uninterrupted anyways, how bad is your service?

Message.Title: soooooony
Message.Msg: Planetside 2 is a free-to-play, massively multiplayer first-person shooter on PC now available from Sony Online Entertainment. Three factions are fighting for control in a battle that will host thousands of troops and their vehicles. Battles can last for days or weeks across huge continents. Congratulations soldier, you turned back an invading force and secured the base. How long can you hold it? At the heart of the game is Sony’s proprietary ForgeLight game engine. It springs from a partnership between NVIDIA and Sony using the PhysX platform. According to Sony, ForgeLight will do away with the use of zones and loading screens in MMOs. It will allow for massive worlds and atmospheric effects as detailed as sunlight filtering through clouds. Movable and player objects will cast shadows will react realistically, possibly lending a battlefield advantage. ForgeLight promises more realistic facial animations on both player and NPC characters. Sony’s using ForgeLight on both Planetside 2 and Everquest Next. It pays to be nice! and smart.

Message.Title: Samsung's Tizen OS could make Google Nervous
Message.Msg: Samsung with its rising ever smartphone market shares, which may surpass Iphone within near future, might also ring a wake up call to Google with its dominant Android. Samsung could flip a coin and might decide to dump Andorid over its Tizen.....Just IMHO ... it could happen! Rumor Tizen smarphone would be availabe by year end. IMHO, Google should pair up with Nivida and go against Apple & Samsung.

Topic.Title: More news on X

Message.Msg: That would be nice but no one will believe it until it happens. Besides it's just a phone although it will help pay the bills in the Tegra Processor division. I like investments in potentially disruptive technologies such as Cloud Gaming. Smartphones are so last year. Maybe cheap smartphones have another couple of years to run. A little history....Once upon a time before PC's, minicomputers sent data and images to thin clients called CRT terminals from the company data center. Is not cloud computing, cloud storage, GPU virtualization using Nvidia VGX, along with Cloud Gaming with Nvidia Grid exactly the same thing. Terminals are cheap, the $$ are in the data center if this trend does unfold.

Topic.Title: More news on X

Message.Msg: Cloud stuff moves relatively slowly - even for main stream apps. Microsoft had to give away their Cloud Office to generate interest. So the big bucks to pay the bills and keep the lights on will have to come from mainstream stuff for a long while to come.

Topic.Title: Samsung's Tizen OS could make Google Nervous

Message.Msg: Samsung has made similar attempts at mobile OS before; all of them failed. The most recent case is Bada OS - have you heard of it? Anyway, it died a year ago after years of promoting. I wouldn't lose sleep over Tizen.
